page.title: 02VILLAGE LIFE BRANSCOMBE.
page.content: The population of Branscombe is about 500 people and they are scattered all over the village. The Post Office is the only shop that sells food and sweets as well as people's allowances and the daily papers.Branscombe Beach is pebbly and it shelves VERY steeply into the sea.There are two pubs in Branscombe,the Masons Arms and the Fountain Head. There are many footpaths in Branscombe ,many are 2-3 miles long. If you go through Pitt Coppice and follow the footpath along and down the cliffs you can get to the beach. You can walk from Branscombe to Weston beach over the cliffs on part of the National Trust coastal footpath. Several cottages and farms are also owned by the National Trust. There is a mini bus service to Seaton and Sidmouth twice a day.
